column4: I've gotten a new SSD Hard drive.  Old one used encryption, new one I don't want ot pay the 50% encryption penalty.  I mounted the old encrypted one under /target during rescue, and copied everything to the new one.  When it boots, it fails to do the crypt setup.  How do I turn that off?
if you were using LVM based full disk encryption, you should be able to edit /etc/crypttab
to my knowledge, you have to edit it, then update your boot stuff in some way
you should probably technically remove the cryptsetup package if you wanted to take that route
